callforshadab wrote:

> Hi,
> After doing my first crawl i got one arc.gz file. I've extracted the
> arc from .gz, now i want to get all my object files from that arc
> file. I tried some arc extractor namely Arc, nmarch, etc etc..
> When i am extracting arc file, it is giving Invalid header error.

Did you see this note from yesterday: 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/2282.

>
> But when i looked up this file using winzip in windows, it was showing
> all text files but there name were started with a question mark.
>
You looked at the arc with winzip or at the arc.gz file with winzip?  If 
the former, winzip is the wrong tool -- use a straight windows editor to 
peruse the arc file.

> I am summarizing my problems as
>
> 1. i have to send all the retrived files in the text format for
> indexing. so how should i do it ??????
>
You need to iterate over all the records in the ARC (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.html). 
Then per record, you need to pass it via an appropriate parser switched 
off the record mime type: e.g. if text/html, pass it via something like 
jtidy or nekohtml, etc.

Have you looked at nutch?  This might be more appropriate to your task.

> 2. is Heritrix fetching pdf and other format files ?? (when i saw the
> records while running the crawler it was showing some pdf files in
> crawl report, but when i am seeing the arc file in winzip, it is only
> showing the text files).
>
By default, yes.

> 3. Is there anyway so that instead of writing the download file in an
> arc format, i can save them in their original format??
>
Check out the mirrorwriter processor in Heritrix: 
http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/writer/MirrorWriterProcessor.html

St.Ack

> I am waiting for your kind help... :-(
>
> Thanks in advance...
> Shadab..
>
>
